questions.question: India has 43 UNESCO World Heritage Sites.
questions.explanation: India is home to a diverse array of 43 UNESCO World Heritage Sites.

questions.question: 35 of India's UNESCO sites are designated for cultural importance.
questions.explanation: 35 sites are designated for cultural importance out of India's 43 UNESCO sites.

questions.question: Diamond was first discovered in South Africa.
questions.explanation: Diamond was first discovered and mined in India, not South Africa.

questions.question: In Sanskrit, diamond is called 'vajra' meaning thunderbolt.
questions.explanation: In Sanskrit, diamond was addressed as 'vajra' meaning thunderbolt.

questions.question: India is the world's largest producer and exporter of tea.
questions.explanation: India is the world's largest producer and exporter of spices, not tea.

questions.question: Auroville was founded in 1968 in Tamil Nadu.
questions.explanation: Auroville was founded in 1968 and is situated mostly in Tamil Nadu.

questions.question: Auroville has provisions for money and religion.
questions.explanation: Auroville has no provisions of money or religion.

questions.question: Indian Postal Service has the most extensive postal system in the world with 154,900 post offices.
questions.explanation: Indian Postal Service with 154,900 post offices is regarded as the most extensive postal system in the world.

questions.question: All 10 of the world's highest peaks are in the Himalayas.
questions.explanation: 9 out of 10 of the world's highest peaks are in the Himalayas, not all 10.

questions.question: India is the only country with a Bill of Rights for cows.
questions.explanation: India is the only country with a Bill of Rights for cows.

questions.question: The Golden Temple serves vegetarian meals to over 100,000 people a day.
questions.explanation: The Golden Temple serves vegetarian meals to over 50,000 people a day, not 100,000.

questions.question: Siachen is the world's highest battlefield.
questions.explanation: Siachen is the world's highest battlefield.

questions.question: Dras is the world's coldest inhabited place.
questions.explanation: Dras is the world's second largest coldest inhabited place, not the coldest.

questions.question: India has more internet users than the entire population of the USA.
questions.explanation: India has more people using the Internet than the entire population of the U.S.

questions.question: The seven states in Northeast India are called the Seven Brothers.
questions.explanation: The seven states in Northeast India are called the Seven Sisters, not Brothers.

questions.question: Centuries-old barter system is still practised at Jonbeel Mela in Assam.
questions.explanation: Centuries-old barter system is still practised at Jonbeel Mela, Assam.

questions.question: Golden/Muga silk is produced in Kerala.
questions.explanation: Golden/Muga silk is exclusively produced in Assam, not Kerala.

questions.question: Ima Keithel is the world's only women-run market located in Manipur.
questions.explanation: Ima Keithel is the world's only women-run market, located in Manipur.

questions.question: Keibul Lamjao National Park is the world's only floating national park.
questions.explanation: Keibul Lamjao National Park in Manipur is the world's only floating national park.

questions.question: At Longwa village in Nagaland, one can be in India and China simultaneously.
questions.explanation: At Longwa village, one can be in India and Myanmar simultaneously, not China.

questions.question: Nagaland has 17 tribes and 36 languages.
questions.explanation: In Nagaland alone, there are 17 tribes and 36 languages.

questions.question: 'Mizoram' means country of people living in hills.
questions.explanation: 'Mi' means people, 'zo' means hills, 'ram' means country - the country of people living in hills.

questions.question: Red Vanda is the state flower of Manipur.
questions.explanation: Red Vanda is the state flower of Mizoram, not Manipur.

questions.question: Neer Mahal is the only floating palace in Northeast India.
questions.explanation: Tripura is home to the only floating palace in Northeast called Neer Mahal.

questions.question: Dong village in Arunachal Pradesh receives the first ray of sun in India after Japan.
questions.explanation: Dong village in Anjaw district, Arunachal Pradesh, is the first place in India to receive the first ray of the sun after Japan.

questions.question: Tawang Monastery is the largest monastery in the world.
questions.explanation: Tawang Monastery is the largest in India and second largest in the world after Potala Palace.

questions.question: Meghalaya is the only state where living root bridges are made.
questions.explanation: Meghalaya is the only state where living root bridges are made.

questions.question: Mawsynram in Meghalaya receives 467 inches of rain per year.
questions.explanation: Mawsynram village in Meghalaya receives 467 inches of rain per year - the rainiest place in the world.

questions.question: Vijaya Lakshmi Pandit was the first Woman President of UN General Assembly.
questions.explanation: Vijaya Lakshmi Pandit was the first Woman President of UN General Assembly.

questions.question: Pratibha Patil was the first tribal woman to become President of India.
questions.explanation: Draupadi Murmu was the first tribal woman to become President of India.

questions.question: M. Fathima Beevi was the first Woman Judge in Supreme Court of India.
questions.explanation: M. Fathima Beevi was the first Woman Judge in the Supreme Court of India.

questions.question: Punita Arora was the first Woman Air Vice Marshal of India.
questions.explanation: Padmavathy Bandopadhyay was the first Woman Air Vice Marshal. Punita Arora was first Woman Lieutenant General.

questions.question: Ahmedabad is called the Boston of India.
questions.explanation: Ahmedabad is called the Boston of India.

questions.question: Ahmedabad was founded in 1511.
questions.explanation: Ahmedabad was founded by Sultan Ahmad Shah in 1411, not 1511.

questions.question: Lucknow is called the City of Nawabs.
questions.explanation: Lucknow is called the City of Nawabs.

questions.question: Lucknow is located on the banks of river Yamuna.
questions.explanation: Lucknow is located on the banks of river Gomati, not Yamuna.

questions.question: Kerala is called the Land of Spices.
questions.explanation: Kerala is called the Land of Spices.

questions.question: Mumbai is called the City of Seven Islands.
questions.explanation: Mumbai is called the City of Seven Islands.

questions.question: Shimla is called the Queen of Mountains.
questions.explanation: Mussoorie is called the Queen of Mountains, not Shimla.

questions.question: Ruskin Bond's hometown is Mussoorie.
questions.explanation: Mussoorie is the hometown of famous writer Ruskin Bond.

questions.question: Zundert, Netherlands holds the largest flower parade in the world.
questions.explanation: Bloemencorso in Zundert, Netherlands holds the largest parade of flowers in the world.

questions.question: The Flower Carpet event in Brussels is organized every year.
questions.explanation: The Flower Carpet event in Brussels is organised once in every two years, not every year.

questions.question: The Rose Parade in Pasadena is organized on New Year's Day.
questions.explanation: The Rose Parade in Pasadena, California is organized on every New Year's Day.

questions.question: Genzano Infiorata Flower Festival has been taking place since 1878.
questions.explanation: The Genzano Infiorata Flower Festival has been taking place since 1778, not 1878.

questions.question: Baju Kurung is the National Dress for Brunei and Malaysia.
questions.explanation: Baju Kurung is a traditional Malay dress and is the National Dress for Brunei and Malaysia.

questions.question: Kimono is traditionally worn in China.
questions.explanation: Kimono is traditionally worn in Japan, not China.

questions.question: Ao Dai is a Vietnamese traditional costume.
questions.explanation: Ao Dai is a Vietnamese costume made of silk material.

questions.question: Cheongsam is also known as the Mandarin gown.
questions.explanation: Cheongsam is also known as the Mandarin gown.

questions.question: Chami Murmu received the Padma Shri award in 2024.
questions.explanation: Chami Murmu was conferred with the Padma Shri award in 2024.

questions.question: Dukhu Majhi is called 'Gachh Dadu' meaning Tree Grandpa.
questions.explanation: Dukhu Majhi is affectionately known as 'Gachh Dadu' (Tree Grandpa).

questions.question: Anirudh Rao invented a tsunami warning system.
questions.explanation: Anirudh Rao invented a Tornado Early Warning System, not tsunami.

questions.question: Over 75% of waste is recyclable.
questions.explanation: Over 75% of waste is recyclable.

questions.question: We recycle about 50% of recyclable waste.
questions.explanation: We only recycle about 30% of waste, not 50%.

questions.question: Paper recycling has increased over 89% since 1990.
questions.explanation: Paper recycling has increased over 89% since 1990.

questions.question: The best way to store a toothbrush is under a cap.
questions.explanation: The best way to store a toothbrush is NOT under a cap - it needs air to dry.

questions.question: Gum disease has been shown to be associated with heart disease, diabetes, and pregnancy.
questions.explanation: Gum disease has been shown to be associated with heart disease, diabetes, and pregnancy.

questions.question: Hard toothbrush bristles are more effective than soft bristles.
questions.explanation: This is false - soft bristles are recommended as plaque is soft and easily removed.

questions.question: 32 teeth exist in the normal adult mouth including wisdom teeth.
questions.explanation: 32 teeth exist in the normal adult mouth including wisdom teeth.

questions.question: 2/3 of the normal tooth is below the gumline.
questions.explanation: 2/3 of the normal tooth is below the gumline.

questions.question: A toothbrush should be changed once a month.
questions.explanation: A toothbrush should be changed once every two or three months.

questions.question: Mouthwash should be used after brushing.
questions.explanation: Mouthwash should be used before brushing, not after.

questions.question: Kumbh Festival had the world's largest gathering of 660 million people.
questions.explanation: Kumbh Festival had the world's largest gathering of 660 million people taking a holy dip in the Ganga.

questions.question: Sunita Williams is the second Indian astronaut to go to space after Rakesh Sharma.
questions.explanation: Shubhanshu Shukla is the second Indian astronaut to go to space after Rakesh Sharma.

questions.question: China created an artificial Sun.
questions.explanation: China created an artificial Sun.

questions.question: Lando Norris won the 2025 F1 Championship.
questions.explanation: Lando Norris is the 2025 F1 Champion.

questions.question: Mumbai will host Commonwealth Games 2030.
questions.explanation: Ahmedabad will host Commonwealth Games 2030, not Mumbai.

questions.question: The world's first Sky Stadium will be built in Dubai.
questions.explanation: The world's first Sky Stadium will be built in Saudi Arabia, not Dubai.

questions.question: India won the ICC Women's Cricket World Cup.
questions.explanation: India won the ICC Women's Cricket World Cup.

questions.question: Mosquitoes were discovered for the first time in Iceland in 2025.
questions.explanation: Mosquitoes were discovered for the first time in Iceland in 2025.

questions.question: UAE has appointed the first AI minister.
questions.explanation: Albania has appointed the first AI minister, not UAE.

questions.question: Indore is the cleanest city of India for the 8th consecutive time.
questions.explanation: Indore is the cleanest city of India for the 8th consecutive time.

questions.question: Chennai Super Kings won IPL 2025.
questions.explanation: Royal Challengers Bangalore won IPL 2025.

questions.question: JD Vance is the Vice President of USA.
questions.explanation: JD Vance is the Vice President of USA.

questions.question: Taylor Swift has the record of highest attended music tour in history.
questions.explanation: Coldplay has the record of highest attended music tour in history.

questions.question: Babies born between 2025 and 2039 belong to Generation Alpha.
questions.explanation: Babies born between 2025 and 2039 belong to Generation Beta.

questions.question: Nirmala Sitharaman is the Finance Minister of India.
questions.explanation: Smt. Nirmala Sitharaman is the Finance Minister of India.

questions.question: Amit Shah is the Defence Minister of India.
questions.explanation: Amit Shah is the Minister of Home Affairs. Rajnath Singh is the Defence Minister.

questions.question: National Youth Day is celebrated on 12th January.
questions.explanation: National Youth Day is celebrated on 12th January - birthday of Swami Vivekananda.

questions.question: World Wildlife Day is celebrated on 3rd April.
questions.explanation: World Wildlife Day is celebrated on 3rd March, not April.

questions.question: International Yoga Day is celebrated on 21st June.
questions.explanation: International Yoga Day is celebrated on 21st June.

questions.question: International Tiger Day is celebrated on 29th July.
questions.explanation: International Tiger Day is celebrated on 29th July.

questions.question: National Sports Day is celebrated on 29th September.
questions.explanation: National Sports Day is celebrated on 29th August, not September.

questions.question: Ramveer Tanwar has saved ten ponds in the past five years.
questions.explanation: Ramveer Tanwar has saved ten ponds in the past five years.

questions.question: Shadab Hassan established a school in Kerala.
questions.explanation: Shadab Hassan established Hamid Hassan High School in Brambe village, Jharkhand.

questions.question: Dr. Bharat Saran provides free medical coaching in Rajasthan.
questions.explanation: Dr. Bharat Saran provides free medical coaching to poor students in Rajasthan.

questions.question: Sahithi Radha's initiative has recycled over 10,000 kg of e-waste.
questions.explanation: Sahithi Radha's E-CYCL-India initiative has facilitated recycling of over 10,000 kg of e-waste.

questions.question: Threads 4 Good has crafted over 5,000 school bags from discarded clothing.
questions.explanation: Threads 4 Good has crafted over 5,000 school bags from approximately 8,400 pieces of discarded clothing.

questions.question: Veer Mehta is working on tornado early warning systems.
questions.explanation: Veer Mehta created 'Turning the Tide' for marine conservation. Anirudh Rao works on tornado warning systems.

questions.question: Kiara Kaur started her environmental journey at age 3.
questions.explanation: Kiara Kaur embarked on her path as an environmentalist at the tender age of 3.

questions.question: Licypriya Kangujam is from Maharashtra.
questions.explanation: Licypriya Kangujam is from Manipur, not Maharashtra.
